definition.title: What is Laparoscopic Gallbladder Removal?
definition.content: Laparoscopic gallbladder removal is a minimally invasive surgical procedure to remove the gallbladder, often due to the presence of gallstones causing pain or infection. The surgery is performed using small incisions and a laparoscope, which allows for faster recovery and minimal scarring.

treatment.title: Treatment Options
treatment.content: Gallbladder removal is the most common treatment for gallstones and other gallbladder issues. Laparoscopic gallbladder removal provides a minimally invasive alternative to traditional open surgery, with quicker recovery times and less pain.
